jd: Hi,I hope you are doing well and having a great day! I wanted to reach out to you regarding a Contract job opportunity as a .Net Lead/PM with NCR POS - Seattle, WA (Onsite). My client has a strong reputation for being one of the leading employers in the industry. After reviewing your qualification and resume, I feel you would be a good fit for this role. I have listed some of the main requirements for this position below for your review. Position Name – .Net Lead/PM with NCR POSType of hiring – ContractLocation – Seattle, WA (Onsite) Job Description: Experience in NCR Retail Point of sale Technical Consulting/Engineering. NCR POS advance store systems deployment, EOM changes, Testing, Development(.Net), Selenium, Load runner, Troubleshoot and resolve hardware and software issue in a timely manner.Kanban Agile methodology, Java, MSSQL Servers, .Net, Power shell, Scripting, Selenium, postman, Windows Task Schedulers.Understanding and modifying existing code to fix bugs and implement changes.Store, Register, ETS Server reboots and Validations.MCM Logs, Splunk logs, Kibana logs.Create, resolve primary production issues using Service now(Waypoint).Creating defect in JIRA, Tender retail and NCR portals.BVT, Smoke testing, Functional testing, Regression testing, End to End testing, BI E2E Testing, Sanity testing, performance testing, System integration testing,working with POS system which has SIGUI, Flat Bed Scanner, handheld scanner, M440 Pin pad.EOM ConfigurationETS tool.Providing technical support, training, NCR POS related enquiries, guidance to the stores.Doing periodic certifications security vulnerabilities, Software upgrades and upon validations.Developing SQL queries, Store procedures using MSSQL server.Jenkins, Gitlab..Net developmentConfluencePreparing SOPs, RCAs, User guides, Conducting trainingsGood experience automation tool Selenium and performance tool load runner Tools:Service Now, Jira, Jenkins, EOM, ETS, Rabbit MQ, Splunk alert, Datadog, Kibana logs, Store locator, VHQ, MCM logs, Retail product search, JFM, GitHub, Confluence, Jump server, AWS.
